channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2024020157
item.description:
Report X-2024020157

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: VIRGINIA BEACH
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO LEAKING PACKAGE IN PPE AND DECISION TREE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET, PUT THE PACKAGE IN A SPILL TUB FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024020068
item.description:
Report X-2024020068

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO THE SOUTH BOXLINE AT 0600 FOR A SPILL, UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER NOTICED A FLAMMABLE PACKAGE THAT LOOKED WET FROM INSIDE OUT. UPON INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE, RESPONDER REALIZED ONE OF THE CAPS WERE LOOSE INSIDE THE BOX.

item.title: Report E-2024020027
item.description:
Report E-2024020027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: LYNCHBURG
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: We have a procedure called the 'Safe 8' that requires the drivers to go through a series of 8 steps to ensure that will help ensure no product spills out when they remove the main discharge cap. This driver did not follow the process as trained so when he uncapped 5 gallons or less spilled out in to the parking lot.
